UI_visible_response: Read 19 web pagesView Page Details"Second Yuan" refers to the second series of the Chinese currency Renminbi (RMB) issued by the People's Bank of China on March 1, 1955. This series was introduced to replace the first series due to issues with the large face values and poor paper quality of the initial currency. The second series included a 2 Yuan note, which featured a deep blue, earth yellow, and gray-blue color scheme with a design of Pagoda Hill on its front. This series of currency was in circulation until it was gradually replaced by subsequent versions of the RMB.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: "Second Yuan" refers to the second series of the Chinese currency Renminbi (RMB) issued by the People's Bank of China on March 1, 1955[^1^]. This series was introduced to replace the first series due to issues with the large face values and poor paper quality of the initial currency[^2^]. The second series included a 2 Yuan note, which featured a deep blue, earth yellow, and gray-blue color scheme with a design of Pagoda Hill on its front[^1^]. This series of currency was in circulation until it was gradually replaced by subsequent versions of the RMB.
